name: tree

onerror.description: The name of a JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

italic.description: Yes or No. Yes displays tree control text in italic. Default is No.

vspace.description: Vertical margin spacing above and below the tree control, in pixels.

onvalidate.description:
The name of a valid JavaScript function used to validate user input. The form object, input 
	object, and input object value are passed to the specified routine, which should return true if 
	validation succeeds and false otherwise.

completepath.description:
Yes passes the root level of the treename.path form variable when the cftree is submitted. If 
	omitted or No, the root level of this form variable is not included. You must set this attribute to 
	Yes for the preserveData attribute of cfform to work with the tree.

required.description: Yes or No. Whether user must select an item in the tree control. Default is No.

message.description: Message text to appear if validation fails.

appendkey.description:
Yes or No. When used with href, Yes passes the CFTREEITEMKEY variable along with the value of 
	the selected tree item in the URL to the application page specified in the cfform action attribute. 
	The default is Yes.

font.description: Font name to use for data in the tree control.

height.description: Height of the tree control, in pixels.

bold.description: Yes or No. Yes displays tree control text in boldface. Default is No.

width.description: Width of the tree control, in pixels.

border.description: Places a border around the tree. Default is Yes.

highlightref.description:
Yes highlights links associated with a cftreeitem with a URL attribute value. No disables 
	highlight. Default is Yes.

notsupported.description:
Text to display if the page containing a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a 
	browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled.

hscroll.description: Permits horizontal scrolling. Default is Yes.

fontsize.description: Font size for text in the tree control, in points.

vscroll.description: Permits vertical scrolling. Default is Yes.

delimiter.description: The character used to separate elements in the form variable path.

name.description: A name for the cftree control.

description:
Lets you put a tree control in a cfform. Validates user selections. Tree items are created with 
  cftreeitem tags inside the cftree tag block. You can use a ColdFusion query to supply data to the tree.
